articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Crispian Balmer, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The U.N. Security Council is also set to vote on a demand for a ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas and humanitarian access across Gaza.
articles.title: US signals veto of UN Security Council demand for Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday openly questioned the point of peace talks with Ukraine after accusing Kyiv's senior leadership of ordering deadly terrorist attacks on bridges in Russia that killed seven and injured 115 more.
articles.title: Putin openly questions peace talks after blaming Ukraine for deadly bridge attack in Russia

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: The Venezuelans were deported in March after Trump invoked the 1798 Alien Enemies Act to swiftly deport alleged members of the Tren de Aragua gang without going through normal immigration procedures.
articles.title: Hundreds of Venezuelans deported to El Salvador have right to challenge detention, judge rules

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Nandita Bose
articles.description: The proclamation fully restricts the entry of nationals from 12 countries including Afghanistan, Haiti and Iran. The entry of people from seven other countries will be partially restricted.
articles.title: Trump bans nationals from 12 countries, citing security concerns

articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Andrea Shalal, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Germany's new chancellor, Friedrich Merz, will hold his first face-to-face talks with U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday in a high stakes meeting in the Oval Office as Europe seeks to stave off looming U.S. tariffs and sustain U.S. backing for Ukraine.
articles.title: Germany's Merz to face Trump in Oval Office on inaugural trip

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iraq's oil ministry said on Thursday it holds the Kurdish regional government (KRG) legally responsible for the continued smuggling of oil from the Kurdish region outside the country.
articles.title: Iraq holds Kurdish government legally responsible for continued oil smuggling

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump signed a proclamation on Wednesday banning the nationals of 12 countries from entering the United States, saying the move was needed to protect against "foreign terrorists" and other security threats.
articles.title: Here are the countries targeted in Trump's new travel ban

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Health authorities in China's southwestern Sichuan province are proposing to extend marriage leave up to 25 days and maternity leave up to 150 days, to help create a "fertility-friendly society" which boosts the country's population.
articles.title: China's Sichuan province to offer extended marriage and maternity leave

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Guatemala, one of Taiwan's few remaining diplomatic allies, reaffirmed its support for the island on Thursday during a visit by President Bernardo Arevalo, who said his people will walk together with their "brothers" in Taiwan.
articles.title: Guatemala president reaffirms support for 'brothers' in Taiwan

articles.author: Julia Payne, Leigh Thomas
articles.description: Trade talks between the European Union and the United States are going in the right direction, Europe's top trade negotiator said, while criticising a doubling of U.S. metals tariffs as a move that did not help with the negotiations.
articles.title: Doubled US tariffs on steel, aluminium kick in as deadline for 'best offers' hits
